Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: Efficient way to divide a list into lists of n size: :I have an ArrayList, which I want to divide into smaller List objects of n size, and perform an operation on each.My current method of doing this is implemented with ArrayList objects in Java. Any pseudocode will do.    for (int i = 1; i <= Math.floor((A.size() / n)); i++) {            ArrayList temp = subArray(A, ((i * n) - n),                    (i * n) - 1);            // do stuff with temp        }    private ArrayList<Comparable> subArray(ArrayList A, int start,                int end) {            ArrayList toReturn = new ArrayList();            for (int i = start; i <= end; i++) {                toReturn.add(A.get(i));            }            return toReturn;        }where A is the list and n is the size of the desired listsI believe this way is taking too much time when working with considerably large lists of up to 1 million in size, so I'm trying to figure out what would be more efficient.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator.next()
<<<explanation>>>: Iterator.next() returns the next element in the iterator.
